intro: Rheedia portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican rheedia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and broad, oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests, often near streams or in rocky crevices. It has a short stem with a woody base and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Rheedia portoricensis is considered a rare and endemic species, contributing to the unique biodiversity of Puerto Rico's flora.
